title: Bourbon Whiskey -- A Brief History of This All-American Drink
text:
Bourbon Whiskey -- A Brief History of This All-American Drink Written by: David Marcus 07/03/15 - 11:18 AM EDT Tickers in this article: BEAM BF.B DEO 
NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- Bourbon has regained its position as most popular spirit in the U.S. Buoyed by the popularity of cocktails and craft distillers, the corn-based whiskey overtook vodka last year as the top-selling spirit category by dollar volume, a trend that seems poised to continue. 
Because bourbon is a truly American drink, the Fourth of July is an appropriate time to delve into its history -- and savor a glass or two. 
Bourbon owes much of its commercial appeal to the connection it offers drinkers to the American past. That link is largely mythological, argues Reid Mitenbuler in his recently published book Bourbon Empire: The Past and Future of America's Whiskey . More Headlines
